item.description:

item.title: Rubbish left in the streets of the corner of Mackenzie Road and Beckenham Road, 5th September
item.description:
The residents in the flats in Beckenham Road and Mackenzie Road corner are leaving refuse sacks outside the property on a Friday expecting a refuse collection but for some reason this area is not on the collection route. This is a continuous problem for the last month and nothing seems to be occurring to address the issue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Motorbikes with no Number Plate, 5th September
item.description:
Two motorbikes are always parked on Lamb Lane at the junction of Andrews Road and have no number plates — not sure if abandoned but shouldn’t be taking up a car parking space if they don’t have number plates. I’m assuming they have no permit. Please clamp!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Andrews Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling bin full, 5th September
item.description:
Mixed Cans 2nd time reporting this is still full up and people leaving stuff on the floor what’s the point of having the recycling ♻️ bins if they don’t get emptied!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking restricts visibility when leaving nursery, 5th September
item.description:
When leaving the nursery and driving onto or walking back onto Havelock Road the parking of cars severely restricts visibility - especially when vans are parked as there is no way to see clearly. Cars speed that road and myself and two children have nearly been hit several times. Both sides of the road are blocked because of parking bays. That allow cars to park right next to the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havelock Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pothole, 5th September
item.description:
This is a really large pothole that is a trip hazard as well as likely to cause damage to cars

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Seacourt Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves, 5th September
item.description:
Street needs cleaning, we have so many leaves we can’t pick them up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brettell Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Again garbage dumped on the alleyway of the Walks, 5th September
item.description:
Fly tipping is constant in this hot spot just off Kings street next to the Walks and Wardell court. Every time it is cleared more appears
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Claybrook Close, Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian Underpass near Finchley Road station., 5th September
item.description:
The above underpass gets flooded on the waterside of the road as soon as few drops come down. It appears to be associated to drain blockage. This has been an ongoing problems for at least 6 months Unfortunately the underpass stinks of urine but not sure much can be done about that or to deter people from urinating in the underpass. All the above results in the pedestrians having to use the traffic lights to cross the road. Particularly busy area due to a number of rot schools around there. Thank you Nicola
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Finchley Road, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking pavements, yelliw lines etc, 5th September
item.description:
Constantly unable to walk on pavements in hutchins road and near areas due to families of students from the 2 schools in this street, who park on pavements, yellow lines, box junctions. Today was hardly room to walk opposite school, no chance for those with wheelchairs who live near by, the rubbish lorry, very difficult to manoeuvre between cars on both sides if road, even though most if one side were on pavement, its also on a bend !! Residents in this street put up with a lot from students, rubbish all over, noise, abuse, what us needed is azregular traffic wardens, especially going home time, and when they gave parents day or such like. Can we get red lines painted in some if these,areas, stop them parking on both sides if street? Ambulance if needed would gave no chance at time to reach a patient.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutchins Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken drain cover - hazard, 5th September
item.description:
There’s a hole in the cover on the pavement, dangerous

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alfearn Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping mattresses & other household items, 5th September
item.description:
Multiple mattresses, fridge doors and and other household items. Items have been piling up over a month. Blocking pedestrian walk way. Located outside flat 70 Orwell court, on Regent's Row by bin collection area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
